intro: Barleria elegans subsp. elegans, commonly known as the slender barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple, arranged in dense spikes at the tips of the branches. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long flowering period and drought tolerance.
